azurerm_eventhub.description: Manages a Event Hubs as a nested resource within an Event Hubs namespace.

name.description: The Name of the Destination where the capture should take place. At this time the only supported value is `EventHubArchive.AzureBlockBlob`.

namespace_name.description: Specifies the name of the EventHub Namespace. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which the EventHub's parent Namespace exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

partition_count.description: Specifies the current number of shards on the Event Hub. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

message_retention.description: Specifies the number of days to retain the events for this Event Hub. Needs to be between 1 and 7 days; or 1 day when using a Basic SKU for the parent EventHub Namespace.

enabled.description: Specifies if the Capture Description is Enabled.

encoding.description: Specifies the Encoding used for the Capture Description. Possible values are `Avro` and `AvroDeflate`.

interval_in_seconds.description: Specifies the time interval in seconds at which the capture will happen. Values can be between `60` and `900` seconds. Defaults to `300` seconds.

size_limit_in_bytes.description: Specifies the amount of data built up in your EventHub before a Capture Operation occurs. Value should be between `10485760` and `524288000`  bytes. Defaults to `314572800` bytes.

skip_empty_archives.description: Specifies if empty files should not be emitted if no events occur during the Capture time window.  Defaults to `false`.

blob_container_name.description: The name of the Container within the Blob Storage Account where messages should be archived.

storage_account_id.description: The ID of the Blob Storage Account where messages should be archived.

partition_ids.description: The identifiers for partitions created for Event Hubs.
